node.title: Tourism industry says clarity on COVID-19 test funding a 'Christmas gift for consumers'
node.alt: A beach dotted with people with blue skies.
node.description: Tourism operators are rejoicing after federal Health Minister Greg Hunt confirmed PCR tests required for anyone travelling in to and out of Queensland, would be funded in a 50–50 arrangement between the federal and state governments.
node.content:
["Tourism operators are rejoicing after federal Health Minister Greg Hunt confirmed PCR tests required for anyone travelling in to and out of Queensland, would be funded in a 50\u201350 arrangement\u00a0between the federal\u00a0and state governments.", "A negative PCR result will be required within 72 hours of travel but the $150 price tag will not\u00a0be the responsibility of holiday-makers.", "Queensland Tourism Industry Council chief executive Daniel Gschwind said it was\u00a0a massive relief for the sector.", "\"I think families will be a lot happier to spend the same amount on a tourism experience and bring themselves a bit of joy, and the industry, instead of spending it on a PCR test,\" he said.", "
Avoiding another massive blow
", "Tourism operators reported a spike in bookings when Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk announced Queensland's roadmap.", "The wave of enthusiasm was overshadowed by a\u00a0realisation a family of four would need to pay\u00a0$600 on COVID-19 tests just to enter the state.", "Mr Gschwind said the cost of testing would've been another blow to an already struggling industry.", "\"The state government and the private sector spent millions of dollars\u00a0trying to attract people now that the borders are open again through marketing, and this would've been a shot in the foot for sure,\" he said.", "He said it was a relief to operators who had been fielding calls from concerned travellers.", "\"We're enormously relieved that these bookings will hopefully hold, and people will arrive in a good mood without having their wallets raided before they get here.\"", "
Arrangement hasn't changed, Hunt says
", "There's been confusion spanning\u00a0several days, over whether test results in the form of a text message would hold up at the Queensland border and why the Commonwealth wouldn't fund PCR tests under Medicare.", "Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt said the 50\u201350\u00a0arrangement had\u00a0been in place for some time.", "\"Testing has been proceeding without incident for the last 18 months,\" he said.", "\"This includes testing required to support entry into another state or territory.\"", "Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk welcomed the clarification in a tweet.", "\"I am pleased people can look forward to being reunited in time for Christmas without additional cost as my government had always planned,\" she said.", "While it was a long road to get to this point, Mr Gschwind said, \"It's a very joyful moment and a Christmas gift for consumers.\"", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
"]
